languageKey.label: Data Filters
Data Filters are a tool designed to retrieve values from a variety of sources and pass them to a Data Provider within the Tesseract framework

Data Filters use a syntax that is close to the one used by the getText function of standard TypoScript. It is used to retrieve values that are passed on to a Data Provider, in order to filter, limit and order the data retrieved by the Data Provider.
Hide
This field is not actively used inside Tesseract.
This field is not considered by the existing components of Tesseract. It could be used to give a visual indication of an obsolete filter. May be used actively in the future or remove altogether.
Title
Some significant name or label for the filter.
Filter configuration
This is where the filter is defined.

The Data Filter uses a syntax that is close to the one used by the getText function of standard TypoScript, but not completely identical. Each line represents one condition. The syntax is the following:
[tag ::] name_of_item_to_test = [key :] value
The tag is used when a filter is stored into session memory, to retrieve its value. This part is optional. The next part must match the name of the item that is going to be tested for the value. For example, in the case the filter is injected into a SQL query, the name of the item will be something like: tablename.tablefield. After the equals (=) sign there can be either a simple value (a number or a string) or an expression that will be parsed (refer to the Base Controller manual for more details on expressions).
Logical operator
Logical operator to be used between each condition defined in the filter.
Ordering configuration
Definition of ordering criteria (field and sorting direction) to be passed to the Data Provider.

This field uses a the following syntax:
field = [key :] value order = [key :] value
"field" is used to define which field will be used for ordering. If the filter is injected into a SQL query, the field will have a syntax like tablename.tablefield. "order" is used to define in which order the data should be sorted. Accepted values are "asc" or "desc". If order is not defined, "asc" will be assumed. After the equals (=) sign there can be either a simple value (a number or a string) or an expression that will be parsed (refer to the Base Controller manual for more details on expressions).
Items per page
Number of items to display at a time.
Either a simple value or an expression (see Base Controller manual) can be used.
Start at page
When results are paginated, which page to start.
Either a simple value or an expression (see Base Controller manual) can be used.
Start at item
Number of the item to start the display at.
Either a simple value or an expression (see Base Controller manual) can be used.
Key for storage
Name to use for storing the filter into session memory.

This must be a simple string. As soon as this field is not empty, the filter is stored into session. The implication if that if a visitor comes back to the same page or some other page containing Tesseract elements refering to that stored filter, previously entered values will be preserved.
Limit to page
Check this box to restrict session storage mechanism to current page only.
